<meta name="description" content="As Russia pressed on with its invasion of Ukraine, a photo of a Russian flag being raised at a building in Kharkiv, Ukraine's second-largest city, circulated in social media posts that claimed it had "fallen". However, the photo was shared in a misleading context; the original photo -- taken by Reuters news agency -- is from a pro-Russian protest in 2014. As of March 2, 2022," />

<meta property="og:description" content="As Russia pressed on with its invasion of Ukraine, a photo of a Russian flag being raised at a building in Kharkiv, Ukraine's second-largest city, circulated in social media posts that claimed it had "fallen". However, the photo was shared in a misleading context; the original photo -- taken by Reuters news agency -- is from a pro-Russian protest in 2014. As of March 2, 2022, fighting was ongoing in Kharkiv after heavy shelling." />

<meta itemprop="description" content="As Russia pressed on with its invasion of Ukraine, a photo of a Russian flag being raised at a building in Kharkiv, Ukraine's second-largest city, circulated in social media posts that claimed it had "fallen". However, the photo was shared in a misleading context; the original photo -- taken by Reuters news agency -- is from a pro-Russian protest in 2014. As of March 2, 2022, fighting was ongoing in Kharkiv after heavy shelling." />

<div class="feature-holder ">
  <span class="image-legend"></span></div>
<article about="/doc.afp.com.32427BX" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document" role="article" data-article-type="" class="node node--article node--promoted node--full node--article--full format-standard full-content post type-post status-publish has-post-thumbnail hentry enable-pin-share node--full node--article--full format-standard full-content post type-post status-publish has-post-thumbnail hentry enable-pin-share">
  <div class="content-header-single">
    <h1 class="content-title">
  Old photo shared in posts claiming 'Russian flag was raised in Kharkiv'</h1>
    <div class="content-meta">
            <span class="meta-author"><a href="/uzair-rizvi" target="_blank">Uzair Rizvi</a>, <a href="/afp-india" target="_blank">AFP India</a></span>      <span class="meta-separator hide"></span>
            <span class="meta-share addtoany"><span class="a2a_kit a2a_kit_size_1 a2a_target addtoany_list" id="da2a_1">
      <a class="icon icon_b s32 facebook a2a_button_facebook"></a>
<a class="icon icon_b s32 twitter a2a_button_twitter"></a>
<a class="icon icon_b s32 envelope a2a_button_email"></a>
      
      
    </span>
    <script type="text/javascript">
<!--//--><![CDATA[//><!--
if(window.da2a)da2a.script_load();
//--><!]]>
</script></span>
      <span class="meta-separator hide"></span>
      <span class="meta-date">
  Published on <span format="" separator="" timestamp="1646201519" class="day hide">Wednesday</span>
        <span class="date">2 March 2022 at 07:11</span></span><span class="meta-separator"></span><span id="meta-date-update-47764" class="meta-date">Updated on <span format="" separator="" timestamp="1646359927" class="day hide">Friday</span>
        <span class="date">4 March 2022 at 03:12</span></span>
    </div>
  </div>
    <div class="disclaimer">Copyright AFP 2017-2022. All rights reserved.</div>
      <div class="article-entry clearfix">
    
  <h3>As Russia pressed on with its invasion of Ukraine, a photo of a Russian flag being raised at a building in Kharkiv, Ukraine's second-largest city, circulated in social media posts that claimed it had "fallen". However, the photo was shared in a misleading context; the original photo -- taken by Reuters news agency -- is from a pro-Russian protest in 2014. As of March 2, 2022, fighting was ongoing in Kharkiv after heavy shelling.</h3><p>The image was shared <a href="https://archive.is/gMcnv#selection-973.0-973.39" rel="noopener" shape="rect" target="_blank"><span>here</span></a> on Facebook on February 24, 2022.</p><p>The caption reads: “Kharkiv falls, Russian flag raised in Kharkiv council.”</p><div id="wysiwyg" class="ww-item image"> <img style="" data-original="" class="lazyload blur-up" src="/sites/default/files/styles/list_xs/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/a59206217b254bd52d7b9b05f2fec934.jpeg?itok=KIjV3Gr6" srcset="/sites/default/files/styles/list_xs/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/a59206217b254bd52d7b9b05f2fec934.jpeg?itok=KIjV3Gr6 415w,/sites/default/files/styles/list_s/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/a59206217b254bd52d7b9b05f2fec934.jpeg?itok=0QvnqTfv 568w, /sites/default/files/styles/list_m/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/a59206217b254bd52d7b9b05f2fec934.jpeg?itok=YHoKzFKI 668w, /sites/default/files/styles/list_l/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/a59206217b254bd52d7b9b05f2fec934.jpeg?itok=RHB8i4cp 888w, /sites/default/files/styles/list_xl/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/a59206217b254bd52d7b9b05f2fec934.jpeg?itok=B82_Hodo 1245w" /><span legend-fid="147625" class="legend">Screenshot of the misleading post taken on February 24, 2022.</span></div><p><a href="https://goo.gl/maps/GJamWVx5gbeY3oGD7" rel="noopener" shape="rect" target="_blank">Kharkiv</a> is 500 kilometres (310 miles) east of Ukraine's capital Kyiv.</p><p>The post circulated online soon after Putin <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iJMiDDzCU_A" rel="noopener" shape="rect" target="_blank">announced</a> Russia was launching military operations on neighbouring Ukraine on February 24, 2022.</p><p>The image was also shared alongside a similar claim in English on Facebook <a href="https://archive.is/zQPEl" rel="noopener" shape="rect" target="_blank">here</a> and in Arabic <a href="https://archive.is/pHItq" rel="noopener" shape="rect" target="_blank">here</a>.</p><p>It was also shared repeatedly in English posts <a href="https://archive.is/wip/HR9be" rel="noopener" shape="rect" target="_blank">here,</a><a href="https://archive.is/wip/aDsCF" rel="noopener" shape="rect" target="_blank">here</a> and <a href="https://archive.is/wip/PaMf5" rel="noopener" shape="rect" target="_blank">here</a> on Twitter.</p><p>However, the photo was shared in a misleading context. </p><p>As of March 2, 2022, fighting was ongoing in Kharkiv after heavy shelling of residential and government buildings, AFP <a href="https://www.bangkokpost.com/world/2272563/biden-touts-western-strength-as-russia-bombards-ukraine" rel="noopener" shape="rect" target="_blank">reported</a>.</p><p>A reverse image and keyword search found the original photo predates the Russian invasion of Ukraine in February 2022.</p><p>It was originally published <a href="https://perma.cc/PWE4-DZE5" rel="noopener" shape="rect" target="_blank">here</a> on Reuters' website on March 1, 2014:</p><div id="wysiwyg" class="ww-item image"> <img style="" data-original="" class="lazyload blur-up" src="/sites/default/files/styles/list_xs/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/1f4ab097e84cb992f0249e243976b8c8.jpeg?itok=jblfVT9v" srcset="/sites/default/files/styles/list_xs/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/1f4ab097e84cb992f0249e243976b8c8.jpeg?itok=jblfVT9v 415w,/sites/default/files/styles/list_s/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/1f4ab097e84cb992f0249e243976b8c8.jpeg?itok=EeHBrZk2 568w, /sites/default/files/styles/list_m/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/1f4ab097e84cb992f0249e243976b8c8.jpeg?itok=2fHK1iOF 668w, /sites/default/files/styles/list_l/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/1f4ab097e84cb992f0249e243976b8c8.jpeg?itok=jBRXtWU6 888w, /sites/default/files/styles/list_xl/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/1f4ab097e84cb992f0249e243976b8c8.jpeg?itok=oeybT1Bq 1245w" /><span legend-fid="147543" class="legend">Screenshot of the original photo on the Reuters' website taken on February 28, 2022.</span></div><p>The photo caption reads in part: "A pro-Russian protester installs the Russian flag at the regional government building after clashes with supporters of Ukraine's new government in central Kharkiv March 1, 2014.”</p><p>Below is a screenshot comparison of the photo in the misleading post (L) and the Reuters image (R):</p><div id="wysiwyg" class="ww-item image"> <img style="" data-original="" class="lazyload blur-up" src="/sites/default/files/styles/list_xs/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/548486b061e2a0038990335eba9071ed.jpeg?itok=2JaH_hxh" srcset="/sites/default/files/styles/list_xs/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/548486b061e2a0038990335eba9071ed.jpeg?itok=2JaH_hxh 415w,/sites/default/files/styles/list_s/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/548486b061e2a0038990335eba9071ed.jpeg?itok=b_W-E-qI 568w, /sites/default/files/styles/list_m/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/548486b061e2a0038990335eba9071ed.jpeg?itok=tKvD5aL8 668w, /sites/default/files/styles/list_l/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/548486b061e2a0038990335eba9071ed.jpeg?itok=0FRUM_9D 888w, /sites/default/files/styles/list_xl/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/548486b061e2a0038990335eba9071ed.jpeg?itok=mx7M-HbP 1245w" /><span legend-fid="147826" class="legend">A screenshot comparison of the image in the misleading posts (L) and the Reuters photo (R)</span></div><p>AFP also captured photos from the same protest <a href="http://u.afp.com/wM8s" rel="noopener" shape="rect" target="_blank">here</a> and <a href="http://u.afp.com/wdU6" rel="noopener" shape="rect" target="_blank">here</a> which show the Russian flag outside the same local government building in Kharkiv.</p><p>The caption for the first photo reads: "Pro-Russian activists place a Russian flag outside the regional government building in Kharkiv after storming the building on March 1, 2014.</p><p>"Dozens were hurt on March 1, 2014 when a pro-Russia protest in Ukraine's eastern city of Kharkiv turned violent, with demonstrators trying to storm the local government building.</p><p>"Some 20,000 joined the protest against Kiev's new pro-West government after the ouster of Kremlin-backed leader Viktor Yanukovych, and later around 300 launched the assault."</p><p>AFP Fact Check has debunked other inaccurate claims about the Russian invasion of Ukraine <a href="/list/all/all/39405/all/1144" rel="noopener" shape="rect" target="_blank">here</a>.</p><div id="wysiwyg" class="ww-item image"> <img style="" data-original="" class="lazyload blur-up" src="/sites/default/files/styles/list_xs/public/medias/factchecking/g2/2022-03/be8e5f68cca4d6ff7ed13f4e499c5803.jpeg?itok=l0InaPBa"
